ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It is very good. But if you do not have the preliminary background for nuclear physics or quantum physics, you will have a tough time to keep up.

The course itself is required, both literally and ideally, for the study of physical chemistry. Just don't fall behind on the lecture, do the HW, and practice exams. Cross is an excellent instructor for it. If you are looking for more advanced study, he can guide you to more advanced materials.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It covers something that is very helpful to me but I can hardly have chance to study in my department. For example, the Monte Carlo.
It has been a great start to study more advanced and practical statistical mechanics.
